Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "v-on:keyup.enter does not work on Android" (#7651) at vuejs/vue
Events.RelatedBody:
### Version
2.5.13

### Reproduction link
[https://jsfiddle.net/50wL7mdz/101586/](https://jsfiddle.net/50wL7mdz/101586/)

### Steps to reproduce
1. Open the link of minimal reproduction on Android Chrome Browser
2. Click in the second field (that contains the text "Hello Vue.js!")
3. Click at the enter key 

### What is expected?
An alert box with the message "Hello Vue.js!" should have been shown.

### What is actually happening?
Nothing. Apparently Android does not recognize the command v-on:keyup.enter and the focus is just changed to the next field.

---
Maybe it's something related to https://stackoverflow.com/questions/36753548/keycode-on-android-is-always-229 , but it may lead to errors in sites that use Vue when accessed via mobile.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Firefox on Windows - HTML select flickers" (#7650) at vuejs/vue
Events.RelatedBody:
![75e440ea674c37f7f64c12d98dbcd8ad841608e2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3961477/36225366-1c788166-11d3-11e8-8a89-120a4d033f58.gif)
### Version
2.5.13

### Reproduction link
[https://jsfiddle.net/86yck9sn/8/](https://jsfiddle.net/86yck9sn/8/)

### Steps to reproduce
1. Go to https://jsfiddle.net/86yck9sn/8/
2. Open ‘Fruit selector’ dropdown
3. Hover over an option "Apple", "Lemon" or "Orange"


### What is expected?
HTML select dropdown should not focus back to currently selected option "Cherry" when model updates.

### What is actually happening?
Witnessing unexpected HTML select dropdown ‘flickering’. Looks to be triggered from unrelated model updates.

---
Tested on

    Firefox 58.0.1 (64-bit), Windows 10 Pro, Version 1703

Working fine on

    Chrome 64.0.3282.140 (64-bit), Windows 10 Pro, Version 1703
    Chrome 63.0.3239.132 (64-bit), MacOS High Sierra, Version 10.13.3
    Safari Version 11.0.3 (13604.5.6), MacOS High Sierra, Version 10.13.3

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "filter is executed on route change" (#2063) at vuejs/vue-router
Events.RelatedBody:
### Version
3.0.1

### Reproduction link
[https://jsfiddle.net/nikugogoi/mj6ajs9e/](https://jsfiddle.net/nikugogoi/mj6ajs9e/)

### Steps to reproduce
filter is called once at the beginning (detected by alert)
again it is called on route change (alert pop up)

### What is expected?
filter should not be executed on route change?

### What is actually happening?
filter is called on route change

---
is This a normal behaviour?

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Incorrent route props in beforeRouteEnter when using <transition>" (#2062) at vuejs/vue-router
Events.RelatedBody:
### Version
3.0.1

### Reproduction link
[http://jsfiddle.net/L7hscd8h/3877/](http://jsfiddle.net/L7hscd8h/3877/)

### Steps to reproduce
1. Open provided jsfiddle.net link;
2. Open browser console;
3. Click on 'first a' <router-link>;
4. Click on 'first b' <router-link>;
5. Click on 'second a' <router-link>;
6. Click on 'first a' <router-link> again;
7. Inspect console output.

### What is expected?
Component props should be set to ones defined in route in `beforeRouteEnter` hook even when transitions are used.

Expected output:
```
vue-component-3: mounted
vm.title: first_a
vm.title: first_b
vue-component-4: mounted
vm.title: second_a
vm.title: first_a
vue-component-3: mounted
```

### What is actually happening?
It seems that props are set after the transition is finished, as well as the `mounted` hook is called. The connection between those two is easily determined by looking at the order of console output with or without transition tag (like at this slightly modified JSFiddle: http://jsfiddle.net/L7hscd8h/3878/).

Actual output:
```
vue-component-3: mounted
vm.title: first_a
vm.title: first_b
vue-component-4: mounted
vm.title: second_a
vm.title: first_b   <--- the problem
vue-component-3: mounted
```

---
I presume this issue has something to do with Vue reusing components (which had only been a pain in the head for me), since it doesn't occur when switching routes with the same component.

It is undeniably vital for correct values of props to be available in `beforeRouteEnter` since they can be used to fetch data asynchronously for components. Or, if you like, not fetching, but sending.

Used versions: 
vue-router 3.0.1 (sha512-vLLoY452L JBpALMP5UHum9 7nzR9PeIBCghU9ZtJ1eWm6ieUI8Zb/DI3MYxH32bxkjzYV1LRjNv4qr8d uX/w==)
vue 2.5.13 (sha512-3D lY7HTkKbtswDM4BBHgqyq qo8IAEE8lz8va1dz3LLmttjgo0FxairO4r1iN2OBqk8o1FyL4hvzzTFEdQSEw==)

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Cannot catch promise in Navigation Guards" (#2061) at vuejs/vue-router
Opened pull request "Fix for #1862" (#2060) at vuejs/vue-router
Events.RelatedBody:
As I am also relying on having dynamically added routes and a fallback 404 route, I tried fixing #1862 by checking not only if the matched routes length changed but also if the matched route itself changed:
`route.matched[0] === current.matched[0]`

Is this a valid way to fix this issue? Or do we have to check if there is more than one matched route?
